name: ball
smallDescription: Used in most sports.
hint: Round object.

name: goal
smallDescription: Area to score points.
hint: Opposite team tries to prevent scoring.

name: net
smallDescription: Mesh fabric to catch ball.
hint: Used in basketball, soccer, and tennis.

name: field
smallDescription: Grassy area to play outdoor sports.
hint: Used in football, soccer, and rugby.

name: court
smallDescription: Surface to play indoor sports.
hint: Used in basketball, tennis, and volleyball.

name: pitch
smallDescription: Playing area in soccer.
hint: Grassy surface with white markings.

name: hoop
smallDescription: Basketball ring.
hint: Orange and rimmed with a net.

name: tee
smallDescription: Support for golf ball at the start of play.
hint: Wooden or plastic stand.

name: club
smallDescription: Used in golf to hit the ball.
hint: Comes in different types for different shots.

name: bat
smallDescription: Used in baseball and cricket.
hint: Long wooden or metal object.

name: puck
smallDescription: Small rubber disc in ice hockey.
hint: Black and hard.

name: skates
smallDescription: Worn on feet for ice sports.
hint: Come in different sizes and types.

name: stick
smallDescription: Used in ice hockey and field hockey.
hint: Long and made of wood or composite material.

name: racket
smallDescription: Used in tennis, badminton, and squash.
hint: Has a stringed surface.

name: glove
smallDescription: Worn by baseball and boxing players.
hint: Protects the hand and fingers.

name: helmet
smallDescription: Protective headgear for contact sports.
hint: Can also be worn in non-contact sports.

name: jersey
smallDescription: Shirt worn by players with their number.
hint: Different colors for different teams.

name: uniform
smallDescription: Clothing worn by team members.
hint: Helps identify team members.

name: score
smallDescription: Number of points earned by a team or player.
hint: Can be a tie or win.

name: referee
smallDescription: Official who enforces the rules of a game.
hint: Wears a black and white striped shirt.

name: coach
smallDescription: Trains and manages the team.
hint: Guides the team strategy.

name: training
smallDescription: Preparation for a sport.
hint: Helps improve performance.

name: fitness
smallDescription: Physical condition to play a sport.
hint: Improves with exercise.

name: exercise
smallDescription: Physical activity to improve fitness.
hint: Can be cardio or strength-based.

name: tournament
smallDescription: Competition with multiple games.
hint: Players compete to advance to the next round.

name: championship
smallDescription: Title for winning a major competition.
hint: The final and most important game of a tournament.

name: medal
smallDescription: Award for placing in a competition.
hint: Gold, silver, and bronze are the most common types.

name: trophy
smallDescription: Award for winning a competition.
hint: Often made of metal or glass and comes in different shapes and sizes.

name: record
smallDescription: Achievement or best performance in a sport.
hint: Can be broken by other athletes in the future.

name: fans
smallDescription: Supporters of a team or sport.
hint: Often wear their team's colors and logo.

name: dribble
smallDescription: Moving the ball with short kicks or bounces.
hint: Used in basketball and soccer.

name: serve
smallDescription: Starting play in tennis and volleyball.
hint: Can determine the outcome of the point.

name: penalty
smallDescription: Punishment for breaking the rules.
hint: Can result in a free kick, penalty kick, or loss of points.

name: referee
smallDescription: Official who enforces the rules of the game.
hint: Wears a striped shirt and carries a whistle.

name: coach
smallDescription: Trains and manages a sports team.
hint: Develops strategies and gives instructions during the game.

name: athlete
smallDescription: Person who competes in sports.
hint: Can participate in one or multiple sports.

name: equipment
smallDescription: Tools or gear used in sports.
hint: Varies depending on the sport.

name: scoreboard
smallDescription: Displays the score of the game.
hint: Located in the stadium or arena for all to see.

name: venue
smallDescription: Location where a sports event takes place.
hint: Can be indoor or outdoor.

name: sponsor
smallDescription: Company that provides financial support for a team or event.
hint: Can have their logo displayed on team uniforms or at the event.

name: injury
smallDescription: Harm or damage to the body.
hint: Can happen due to contact with other players or overuse.

name: tournament bracket
smallDescription: Visual representation of tournament matchups.
hint: Helps players and fans keep track of who is playing whom.

name: overtime
smallDescription: Extra period of play to determine a winner.
hint: Occurs when the game is tied at the end of regulation.

name: red card
smallDescription: Penalty card given to a player for a serious violation.
hint: Results in the player being sent off the field.

name: yellow card
smallDescription: Warning card given to a player for a minor violation.
hint: Two yellow cards result in a red card.

name: underdog
smallDescription: Team or player not favored to win.
hint: Can cause excitement and surprise when they win.

name: rivalry
smallDescription: Intense competition between two teams or players.
hint: Often fueled by a long history of games and personal animosity.

name: sprint
smallDescription: Short burst of running at maximum speed.
hint: Used to gain an advantage or catch up to the opponent.

name: league
smallDescription: Organized group of teams that compete against each other.
hint: Often has a regular season and playoffs.

name: home field advantage
smallDescription: Advantage a team has when playing at their own stadium or arena.
hint: Can include familiarity with the playing surface and support from fans.

name: equipment
smallDescription: Tools and gear used to play a sport.
hint: Examples include balls, rackets, and helmets.

name: offside
smallDescription: Violation that occurs when an attacking player is closer to the opponent's goal than the ball and the second-to-last defender.
hint: A common rule in soccer.

name: clearance
smallDescription: Defensive move where the ball is kicked or hit away from the goal.
hint: Used to prevent scoring by the opponent.

name: huddle
smallDescription: Circle of players who come together to discuss strategy.
hint: Used in many sports, including American football and basketball.

name: jumper
smallDescription: Player who takes a jump shot in basketball.
hint: Often used by taller players to shoot over defenders.

name: penalty kick
smallDescription: Free shot taken from a set distance in soccer.
hint: Given to a team after a major violation by the opponent in the penalty area.

name: relay
smallDescription: Team event where each member takes a turn to complete a portion of the race.
hint: Used in many sports, including track and field and swimming.

name: umpire
smallDescription: Official who enforces the rules of the game and makes calls.
hint: Used in many sports, including baseball and tennis.

name: warm up
smallDescription: Pre-game routine to prepare the body for exercise.
hint: Includes stretching and light exercise to prevent injury.

name: underhand serve
smallDescription: Serving technique in which the ball is hit with an underhand motion.
hint: Used in sports like volleyball and pickleball.

name: touchdown
smallDescription: Scoring play worth 6 points in American football.
hint: Occurs when the ball is carried or caught in the opponent's end zone.

name: field goal
smallDescription: Scoring play worth 3 points in American football.
hint: Occurs when the ball is kicked through the opponent's goalposts.

name: quarterback
smallDescription: Offensive player who passes or hands off the ball to other players.
hint: Considered the leader of the offense.

name: line of scrimmage
smallDescription: Imaginary line on the field where the ball is placed before each play.
hint: Determines where the play begins and where players can line up.

name: offensive line
smallDescription: Group of players who block for the quarterback and running backs.
hint: Forms a protective wall around the ball carrier.

name: sack
smallDescription: Tackle of the quarterback behind the line of scrimmage.
hint: Can result in a loss of yards for the offense.

name: interception
smallDescription: Defensive play where a player catches a pass intended for an offensive player.
hint: Results in a change of possession.

name: fumble
smallDescription: Loss of possession due to the ball carrier dropping the ball.
hint: Can be recovered by either team.

name: punt
smallDescription: Offensive play where the ball is kicked to the opponent.
hint: Usually done on fourth down to give the opponent a longer field to work with.

name: red zone
smallDescription: Area between the opponent's 20-yard line and their goal line.
hint: Considered a scoring opportunity for the offense.

name: center
smallDescription: Offensive lineman who snaps the ball to the quarterback.
hint: Usually the tallest player on the offensive line.

name: guard
smallDescription: Offensive lineman who blocks for the quarterback and running backs.
hint: Usually lines up on either side of the center.

name: tackle
smallDescription: Offensive lineman who blocks for the quarterback and running backs.
hint: Lines up on the outside of the guards.

name: wide receiver
smallDescription: Offensive player who catches passes from the quarterback.
hint: Usually lines up on the outside of the offensive formation.

name: tight end
smallDescription: Offensive player who blocks and catches passes from the quarterback.
hint: Lines up next to the offensive line.

name: running back
smallDescription: Offensive player who runs with the ball and catches passes from the quarterback.
hint: Usually lines up behind the quarterback.

name: defensive tackle
smallDescription: Defensive player who lines up in the middle of the defensive line.
hint: Usually the largest player on the defense.

name: defensive end
smallDescription: Defensive player who lines up on the outside of the defensive line.
hint: Responsible for containing the ball carrier.

name: linebacker
smallDescription: Defensive player who lines up behind the defensive line and tackles ball carriers.
hint: Considered the heart of the defense.

name: cornerback
smallDescription: Defensive player who covers wide receivers.
hint: Usually lines up on the outside of the defensive formation.

name: safety
smallDescription: Defensive player who defends against both the pass and the run.
hint: Responsible for covering the deep part of the field.

name: kicker
smallDescription: Special teams player who kicks the ball during kickoffs, field goals, and extra points.
hint: Usually the team's best kicker.

name: punter
smallDescription: Special teams player who kicks the ball to the opposing team on fourth down.
hint: Usually the team's best kicker.

name: long snapper
smallDescription: Special teams player who snaps the ball to the punter or kicker.
hint: Usually the team's center on special teams.

name: point guard
smallDescription: Offensive player who initiates the team's offensive plays.
hint: Considered the floor general and primary ball-handler.

name: shooting guard
smallDescription: Offensive player who primarily scores points through jump shots and three-pointers.
hint: Often the team's best perimeter shooter.

name: small forward
smallDescription: Offensive player who is versatile and plays multiple roles on the court.
hint: Can score, rebound, and pass the ball effectively.

name: power forward
smallDescription: Offensive player who typically plays close to the basket and scores primarily through layups and dunks.
hint: Often the team's best rebounder.

name: center
smallDescription: Offensive player who plays closest to the basket and is responsible for scoring points through putbacks and dunks.
hint: Usually the tallest player on the team.

name: pitcher
smallDescription: Player who throws the ball to the opposing team to start a play.
hint: Responsible for throwing strikes and getting batters out.

name: catcher
smallDescription: Player who stands behind home plate and catches pitches thrown by the pitcher.
hint: Responsible for calling pitches and catching foul balls.

name: first baseman
smallDescription: Player who defends the area near first base and catches throws from other infielders.
hint: Often the team's best defensive player.

name: second baseman
smallDescription: Player who defends the area near second base and catches throws from other infielders.
hint: Often the team's best double play turner.

name: shortstop
smallDescription: Player who defends the area between second and third base and catches throws from other infielders.
hint: Often the team's best all-around fielder.

name: third baseman
smallDescription: Player who defends the area near third base and catches throws from other infielders.
hint: Often the team's best defensive player.

name: outfielder
smallDescription: Player who defends the outfield and catches fly balls hit by the opposing team.
hint: Responsible for preventing home runs and extra-base hits.

name: defenseman
smallDescription: Player who primarily defends the team's zone and tries to prevent the opposing team from scoring.
hint: Often the team's strongest skater and hardest hitter.

name: center
smallDescription: Player who takes faceoffs and is responsible for both offense and defense.
hint: Often the team's best all-around player.

name: left winger
smallDescription: Offensive player who attacks the opposing team's zone from the left side of the rink.
hint: Often the team's best scorer.

name: right winger
smallDescription: Offensive player who attacks the opposing team's zone from the right side of the rink.
hint: Often the team's best scorer.

name: dunk
smallDescription: Scoring a basket by jumping high and slamming the ball through the hoop.
hint: A flashy way to score.

name: alley oop
smallDescription: A high pass caught by a teammate in mid-air and dunked in the basket.
hint: A difficult play to pull off, but impressive when executed correctly.

name: fast break
smallDescription: A play in which a team quickly moves the ball up the court to score before the opposing team can set up its defense.
hint: A high-speed offensive play that requires quick passing and fast footwork.

name: pick and roll
smallDescription: A play in which one player sets a screen for a teammate with the ball, then rolls to the basket to receive a pass and score.
hint: A common play used to create scoring opportunities.

name: rebound
smallDescription: Grabbing the ball after a missed shot or free throw.
hint: A key part of the game, especially on the defensive end.

name: assist
smallDescription: Passing the ball to a teammate who then scores.
hint: An important statistic for evaluating a player's ability to create scoring opportunities for others.

name: block
smallDescription: Stopping a shot by getting in the way and deflecting the ball.
hint: A defensive play that requires good timing and jumping ability.

name: steal
smallDescription: Taking the ball away from an opposing player without fouling.
hint: A defensive play that can quickly shift momentum in a game.

name: zone defense
smallDescription: A defensive strategy in which each player guards a specific area of the court instead of an individual player.
hint: A way to prevent penetration and force outside shots.

name: inning
smallDescription: The period of play in which each team gets a turn at bat and in the field.
hint: A game is typically played over nine of these.

name: home run
smallDescription: A hit that allows the batter to circle all the bases and score a run.
hint: One of the most exciting plays in baseball.

name: double play
smallDescription: A defensive play in which two opposing players are put out on a single play.
hint: A great way to quickly end an inning.

name: bunt
smallDescription: A technique in which the batter lightly taps the ball and attempts to reach first base before being thrown out.
hint: A useful play when a runner needs to be moved into scoring position.

name: steal
smallDescription: When a runner advances to the next base without the ball being hit or a walk being issued.
hint: A risky play, but can be a game-changer.

name: slider
smallDescription: A type of pitch that appears to be a fastball but then breaks away from the batter's bat.
hint: A difficult pitch for batters to hit.

name: curveball
smallDescription: A type of pitch that curves downward as it approaches the batter.
hint: Another tricky pitch to hit.

name: fastball
smallDescription: A pitch thrown with maximum velocity.
hint: One of the most common pitches in baseball.

name: sacrifice fly
smallDescription: A fly ball that allows a runner to score after being caught by an outfielder.
hint: A way to trade an out for a run.

name: error
smallDescription: A defensive misplay that allows a batter or runner to reach base safely.
hint: An unfortunate mistake for the fielding team.

name: stickhandling
smallDescription: The skill of moving the puck along the ice using a hockey stick.
hint: A fundamental skill for all hockey players.

name: slap shot
smallDescription: A powerful shot that involves swinging the stick down and striking the puck with the blade.
hint: One of the hardest shots in hockey.

name: wrist shot
smallDescription: A quick and accurate shot that involves flicking the wrist to shoot the puck.
hint: A versatile shot that can be used in many situations.

name: body check
smallDescription: A defensive technique in which a player makes physical contact with an opponent to separate them from the puck.
hint: A key part of playing defense in hockey.

name: icing
smallDescription: A violation that occurs when a player shoots the puck across both the center red line and the opposing team's goal line.
hint: Results in a stoppage of play and a face-off in the offending team's zone.

name: offside
smallDescription: A violation that occurs when an attacking player enters the offensive zone before the puck.
hint: Results in a stoppage of play and a face-off outside the offending team's zone.

name: power play
smallDescription: A situation in which one team has a numerical advantage due to a penalty being assessed to the other team.
hint: A prime opportunity to score a goal.

name: penalty kill
smallDescription: A situation in which one team is shorthanded due to a penalty being assessed.
hint: The objective is to prevent the other team from scoring while down a player.

name: face off
smallDescription: A method used to start play in which an official drops the puck between two opposing players.
hint: Occurs at the beginning of each period, after a goal is scored, and after stoppages in play.

name: hat trick
smallDescription: A term used when a player scores three goals in a single game.
hint: A rare and impressive feat.

name: gutter
smallDescription: The troughs on either side of the lane where the ball can end up if it doesn't hit any pins.
hint: The bane of many bowlers' existence.

name: strike
smallDescription: Knocking down all ten pins with one roll of the ball.
hint: The best possible outcome on a single roll.

name: spare
smallDescription: Knocking down all ten pins with two rolls of the ball.
hint: A common and important outcome in bowling.

name: split
smallDescription: A leave in which the headpin is knocked down, but at least one pin on either side of it remains standing.
hint: A difficult leave to convert.

name: turkey
smallDescription: Scoring three consecutive strikes in a single game.
hint: A term used to describe a hot streak.

name: perfect game
smallDescription: Scoring twelve consecutive strikes in a single game.
hint: The ultimate achievement in bowling.

name: approach
smallDescription: The area of the lane where the bowler takes their steps before releasing the ball.
hint: A critical part of the bowling process.

name: finger holes
smallDescription: The three holes drilled into the ball where the bowler inserts their fingers.
hint: A key part of a bowler's grip on the ball.

name: alley
smallDescription: The narrow lane where the bowling ball is rolled.
hint: The setting for the game of bowling.

name: handicap
smallDescription: A system used to level the playing field by giving lower-skilled bowlers a higher score to start with.
hint: Allows bowlers of different skill levels to compete on an even playing field.

name: fairway
smallDescription: The strip of shorter grass between the tee box and the green where golfers are expected to hit their shots.
hint: A prime location for tee shots.

name: rough
smallDescription: The longer, thicker grass on either side of the fairway.
hint: A hazard that can make shots more difficult.

name: putt
smallDescription: A golf shot made on the green, usually with a putter.
hint: A critical part of the game of golf.

name: birdie
smallDescription: Scoring one stroke better than par on a hole.
hint: A desirable outcome in golf.

name: eagle
smallDescription: Scoring two strokes better than par on a hole.
hint: A rare but exciting achievement in golf.

name: bogey
smallDescription: Scoring one stroke worse than par on a hole.
hint: A common outcome in golf.

name: par
smallDescription: The predetermined number of strokes a skilled golfer is expected to take to complete a hole or a course.
hint: A standard of measurement in golf.

name: caddie
smallDescription: A person who carries a golfer's clubs and provides advice and assistance during a round of golf.
hint: An important role in golf.

name: sand trap
smallDescription: An area of sand near the green that is considered a hazard.
hint: A challenging obstacle on many golf courses.

name: driver
smallDescription: The longest club used for tee shots and long drives.
hint: Often used for the first shot of each hole.

name: fairway wood
smallDescription: A club with a long, rounded head designed for shots off the fairway.
hint: Useful for long shots that are not from the tee.

name: hybrid
smallDescription: A combination of an iron and a wood, designed for versatility and ease of use.
hint: A newer type of club that has become increasingly popular.

name: iron
smallDescription: A club with a flat, angled face, used for shots from the fairway or rough.
hint: Comes in different sizes, numbered from 1 to 9.

name: wedge
smallDescription: A type of iron with a high loft, used for shots that require a high, short trajectory.
hint: Comes in different varieties, such as sand wedges and pitching wedges.

name: putter
smallDescription: A club used for putting on the green.
hint: Critical for finishing off each hole.

name: drafting
smallDescription: Tactic of following closely behind another car to reduce wind resistance and increase speed.
hint: Often used on superspeedways.

name: restrictor plate
smallDescription: Device used to limit the amount of air and fuel that enters the engine, reducing speed for safety purposes.
hint: Required at certain tracks, such as Daytona and Talladega.

name: Pit road
smallDescription: Area where teams can change tires, refuel, and make adjustments to the car during a race.
hint: Critical for maintaining performance during long races.

name: pace car
smallDescription: Official car that leads the field during caution periods and the start of the race.
hint: Sets the speed limit for the cars on the track.

name: chicane
smallDescription: A series of tight turns on a road course, designed to slow down the cars and increase the difficulty of the track.
hint: Used to create more passing opportunities.

name: aero push
smallDescription: The tendency of a car to push towards the outside of a turn due to aerodynamic effects.
hint: Can be caused by driving too closely to other cars.

name: burnout
smallDescription: A maneuver in which a driver spins the wheels of their car to create smoke and celebrate a victory.
hint: Can also be used to warm up the tires before a race.

name: caution flag
smallDescription: A flag displayed by officials to indicate a hazard on the track, such as an accident or debris.
hint: Causes the cars to slow down and follow the pace car until the hazard is cleared.
